channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [SOLR-84] Logo Contests
item.description:
This issue was original a scratch pad for various ideas for new Logos. It is now being used as a repository for submissions for the Solr Logo Contest...

http://wiki.apache.org/solr/LogoContest

Note that many of the images currently attached are not eligible for the contest since they do not meet the official guidelines for new Apache project logos (in particular that the full project name "Apache Solr" must be included in the Logo). Only eligible attachments will be included in the official voting.

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: It looks very nice. I like it much better than the one we have now. +1.
solr-84-source-files.zip contains Adobe Illustrator and SVG versions of the proposed logo.

Here's the logo without the crescent. IMO it looks better... less cluttered.

-linda

I like the version without the crescent. The crescent makes me think Moon, which makes no sense in Sol(a)r context. I'm not in love with the "robotic" font. The Sun is a source of life on planet Earth, so I'd personally prefer gentler, more oval and more human-feeling font.

I took the contents of the zip file and made a logo without the crescent, but with an 'o' that has the diffused rays where the crescent used to be.

In the new zip are a full size version, an original logo sized version, and a new cropped version.
Nice, I like it. Now what can we do with a logo for Solr Flare?! (alluding to an upcoming logo contest for it... nudge nudge)
I just posted a logo variation by my friend, Juan Sanabria. It has softer letters and a more interisting sun. (JIRA did not resize it well though, so look at the original)

The rounded characters are nice. The sun's red color and open middle aren't so nice IMHO.

Erik: perhaps an animated gif that fires out from the Solr's "o" and engulfs our planet?

I dig the version Ryan posted ... the rounded letters really make a huge differnece – as for the colors of the sun, i think that red is a bit too ... red. I think the color palate of the current Solr logo would look better.

The white in the center of the "o" makes it an obvious "o", but a less obvious sun ... which made me think about the "o" in previous versions. I think a solid orange circle would make a good Sun/"o", and in the context of the other letters would be an obvious character ... it could then have a radiating gradient or light orange to yellow ... it seems like that owuld be a good balance between the two designs posted so far.

one other personal opinion: with teh crescnet, the "r" looks okay, but without it, we probably want to narrow it a bit – it sticks way out there.

As for a logo for "Flare" ... i think resusing the current "Solr on fire" logo might be perfect

What, no kryptonians around here?

I like the rounded letters too. w.r.t. the "r" comment, perhaps try making it the same width as the "s"?

More variations from Juan. So far I like logo-solr-e.jpg best, perhaps with a larger sun and shorter "r"

Make sure to look at the original image - not the one JIRA resizes.

My vote is for logo-solr-d.jpg. The r now matches the s in width and the sun is
easier on the eye.
in logo-solr-d.jpg, should the "r" be the same height as the "s", or is it intentionally shorter?

I like the more muted colors and larger O size of "e" ... but i still think having a sun/O with a solid (non white) center might look better.

as far as letter sizing ... i think the r really needs to be narrower – it currently sticks outway to far to the right.

the s and the r should probably either be the same height, or the s should be significantly taller (ie; capitalized)
FWIW, I like the shining/rays effect of "d" and "e".

more variations from juan...

of them, i like c, g, or h.

though i don't think any is a real winner yet...
From the logo grid, b (all capital letter and same size).
another possible direction...

Me LIKE the new one!
https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12353535/solr-nick.gif
Much happier and less robotic!

Same here, solr-nick.gif is cool!

IMHO it just needs "something" to make the letters stand out a bit more, maybe a bit of thin white spacing around the letter shapes?
Hope it's not too late to sneak in some more ideas. This version works particularly well as a companion to the 'solr flare' version.
Here's yet another variation [sslogo-solr2] (BTW, disregard the black background version of sslogo-solr; I tried to paste a PNG that had a transparent background).

I still like #7 the best. #10's ( sslogo-solr-flare.jpg ) flame is cool, though "FLARE" part would have to be removed, so there is no confusion with Solr flare stuff that Erik & Co. have been working on.

I like #10

I asked Juan (#3) to take another look... results are interesting, but I'm not sure how useful: http://lapnap.net/solr/ – perhaps (f)?

Nick (#7) is going to take another shot at something "more professional" as that seemed to be what people did not like about it.

>
> Hope it's not too late to sneak in some more ideas
>

Not at all! Keep em coming! I don't think we should rush to get this out with solr 1.2...

something else to look at...

  • - - -

I just deleted a duplicate image i had uploaded months ago, and the logo with black background Steve asked to ignore.

(I know deleting is generally not a good practice, but in this case I think it helps)
Oops, deleting files renames the numbering - the #7 that Otis and I pointed to in the above comments is now #8.
Those are great Steve! Thanks for submitting them.
Yet another spin, this time without any flares. (FWIW, the edges and colors appear better in the original)

I kinda like the sun image from:
http://www.fiftiesweb.com/fashion/60s-fashion-logo.gif
Some of these logos are awesome, and all of them are (IMHO) better than the current one - why not update to one?
Some ideas for a black & white version of the logo

Attached solr.s1.jpg – variation of "logo-solr-d.jpg", the white center of the O allows resizing smaller without using red. Concept is consistent height and thinner S. Used capital L to avoid confusion with I vowel. Kept the lowercase R; a capital R destroys the simplicity. I like the rounded corners, although they disappear at smaller sizes. (Use half-circles for all ends?)

Logo must include "Apache". Added as white text inside the S. Disappears at smaller sizes so we may need two versions to meet this requirement at small sizes.

Solr is for the "enterprise" and needs a logo acceptable to large companies. IMO, none of the logos with flames meet this standard.
It is burning! ... Apache Solr Logo contest submition (based on my previous draft http://picasaweb.google.cz/lukas.vlcek/Solr)

Updating issue summary and description to explicitly refer to Logo Contest.

For posterity: bdelacretaz credited "Nicolas Barbay (nicolas (put at here) sarraux-dessous.ch)" as the creator of the logo's he attached when initially creating this issue.
adding linkage referred to in original description.
My entry for the logo contest It's a bit more "square" than most of the others. What do you think?
Greyscale version of my logo contest entry.

Attached solr.s2.jpg – Modified from sslogo-solr.jpg. Stretched the top and bottom of the S. Beheaded the L. Changed O to pure red and ate the filling. Added "APACHE" using filling color with red outline. Still striving for enterprise acceptance.
A small version for voting.
A second attempt (solr_attempt2) using a different fireball. Will gladly attach the higher res if it is required.
my attempt for a logo. if a vector version is wished i will provide it.

regarding solr_attempt.jpg and solr_attempt2.jpg submitted by "Lozer T. User" ... i suspect the "slogan" under these logos won't appeal to some people, and the concepts might fare better in voting without them
Yeah, the slogan won't appeal it was just space filler. But it doesn't matter anyway. Moritz Platt just destroyed my entries. I seriously think that entry is the better.

Just a reminder: the official guidelines for new Apache project logos require that the full project name "Apache Solr" must be included in the Logo ... Moritz's submission would need the word "Apache" incorporated in some way to make it eligible.

(I would have mentioned that in my last comment, but i must have been looking at a stale version of the page, i didn't notice Moritz's submission until now)

Attached solr.s3.jpg - Fixed O and added color and inner bezels to solr.s2.jpg.

@Lozer T. User: solr_attempt2.jpg is my second favorite and the only pleasing flames. Could you please:
1. Delete the slogan. Logos do not include taglines.
2. Fix the O to appear as a complete circle. The current version reads SULR.
3. Tighten the words. Reduce the space between the letters in "Apache". Also move the R closer to the L (and maybe the L slightly behind the flames.)

Me like Lukas' apache_solr_contour.png – https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12393911/apache_solr_contour.png. I like the bold SOLR part. I think the font for the "apache" part could be a little less...little simpler (without the "flying ends") and maybe Lukas' old flames from apache_solr_sun.png ( https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/thumbnail/12392306/12392306_apache_solr_sun.png ) might look nice inside the "O" in apache_solr_contour.png.
Since it is getting close to the deadline and I don't want to see moritz's entry not qualify, I'll enter it in with the apache name.
This is the Jpeg version called logo_remake.

I like https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12349896/logo-solr-e.jpg and https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12358494/sslogo-solr.jpg, because they're simple and scale down well. It should be possible to scale the logo, or a salient part of it, as small as a favicon (16x16) and still have it easily recognized. Most of the designs above require a lot of pixels to be recognizable. A good logo should be iconic more than textual--an abstract symbol.

Often you can sample an element of a logo to form a favicon (like we do with Lucene's 'L'). So, when voting, think about whether there's an easily identifiable sample (e.g., is the typeface of the 'S' distinctive?).

I note that Steve Stedman did not provide his logos under the Apache license. Was that intentional? I like his quite a lot...
I just pinged Steve Stedman (a personal friend) about getting his contributions ASL'd. Thanks for noting that Doug.
Attached is my revised logo with the full Apache Solr project name. I can also revise my other previous logos (and correcting the license issue) if it seems worthwhile.
...and some additional variations. Thanks for the heads-up, Erik.
This is my first entry. My intent was to show a reference to search using the familiar magnifying glass image incorporated into the design.

I'm liking
https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12393951/sslogo-solr-classic.png

People with multiple entries should beware of splitting the vote amongst similar ones though. It's less of an issue with the proposed voting rules (assuming people throw their other votes towards those similar ones), but probably still has an effect.
Whats up with this vector rule? Only vector logos? Weak.

> I'm liking https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12393951/sslogo-solr-classic.png

Me too.

Whats up with this vector rule? Only vector logos? Weak.

The PRC requires that there be a scalable "vector" format for official logos so the can be reproduced at any size.

for the contest we're not requiring that people submit a vector version, but "if your entry is selected to be the new Solr Log you must provide the "scalable vector, print quality version of the logo" prior to the selecting being official."
Im really liking: https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12394218/solr-solid.png
Apache Solr, with some sun flares... as simple as that

Nice. Like yonik mentions above though...watch splitting the vote with all of those variations. Thats some good stuff, I'd hate to see it go down to a 4-6 way split. Too bad we can't vote on families and then the winner from that family...gets complicated quick though.

Its nice to see a lot of good options coming in. I like it! thanks everyone!

Danny, any chance we could see:

with an upper case 'R'?
Hmmm... isn't https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12394281/solr2_maho.png too close to official Sun Solaris logo: http://toastytech.com/guis/sol10logo.png ?

So you can see the images next to each other:


not sure....

watch splitting the vote with all of those variations. ... Too bad we can't vote on families and then the winner from that family...

Dooh – I know we should have discussed this more when setting the "rules".

I think more variations are good – I think selecting a family, then refining that is a good option. On: http://wiki.apache.org/solr/LogoContest, I grouped things into the 'families' that I think should count as the same 'vote'

The one hitch would be that if someone votes for multiple items in the same 'family' it could skew the stats – in that case, I suggest we ask the person to recast their 'vote' (it is a public ballot after all)

In particular, I like the logo:

but would love to see a different font, with perhaps a different treatment of "apache". Maybe the flame on the "R". It would be a shame to discourage that.

I like the new "maho" series of logos, but do agree the look is a little close to Solaris'. How about moving the sun's ways right above the letter "O"?
How about incorporating a bit of Apache's purple in that gradient?
Or how about using the little Apache feathers as quasi solar rays? (could be ugly, but might be worth a try)
Not flying now...

The logo presented is clean and simple, the use of the feather in a circular shape grabs your attention and makes it memorable. The combination of the graphic and type creates a positive, solid and trustworthy image. Also it is effective in different colors and scalable in all sizes. (please open second attachment for the vector file .zip).

The logo presented is clean and simple, the circular graphic of the feather grabs your attention and makes the logo memorable. The combination of the graphic and type creates a positive, solid and trustworthy image. The logo is effective in different colors and scalable in all sizes (please see next attachment for vector file).

Ryan, here is what it could look like with an uppercase R.

If this is going to be voted on, perhaps it could be grouped with the lower case r version (solr-solid.png), or just replace the lower case version if it is clearly preferable.

Thanks.

Attached solr.s4.jpg – modified from apache_solr_c_red.jpg. Tightened the elements and changed font of "Apache".

If one of "my" entries wins, please credit the original designer with "as modified by solprovider". The original designer can decide my portion of the prizes.

I think more variations are good - I think selecting a family, then refining that is a good option.

Changing the rules now wouldn't be fair to the people who have been submitting ideas and then retracting them and resubmitting variations based on feedback. (they would have only one entry in that "family" to earn votes)

We should stick to the voting as established. Fortunately the two separate votes (first by the community and then a binding vote by committers) gives committers the flexibility for take into account the total scores for a "family" of designs before casting final votes.

Also: just because the deadline for submitting new designs is in ~8 hours, doesn't mean we have to hold the vote immediately – we can give people time to discuss each of the "families" and which one is the strongest candidate from each and let the creator retract any less popular variations before holding the vote.
Theres that "gets complicated quick" part

Attached solr.s5.jpg – modified from solr_attempt2.jpg. Removed line and slogan. Added top of O. Consistent height of letters. Tighter.

If grouping "families", include with solr_attempt2.jpg and decide later which version is preferred.

Oh no! My logo really looks like the Solaris logo
I wasn't aware of that. Let's see if I can make some modifications using the suggestions posted here.

This one is a fresh idea. Unlike the other ones which just focus on the name (Solar) , This also focuses on the functionality (Solr is a search server).

My vote goes for this
this is derived from 'solr2_maho.png' I'm posting it so we have something to vote on
Attached solr.s7.jpg. Very resizable. Focus on search rather than "solar".

the contest submissions are now closed (see http://wiki.apache.org/solr/LogoContest) – however, unless there are objects, I'll go ahead and add solr.s7.jpg to the final list.

I'll send out a draft instruction email shortly.

The Logo Contest has been concluded, congrats to Michiel for his winning entry...

https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12394264/apache_solr_a_red.jpg
